intro: Scrithacola kurramensis, commonly known as the Kurramensis scurfpea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist climates. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing forage for wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
